contextId.information: AT: "us who genuinely try to do what you want us to do. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: servants who walk before you with all their heart

contextId.information: This refers to the promise that God made to David that his son would build the temple. AT: "you have fulfilled your promise." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: you spoke with your mouth and have fulfilled it with your hand

contextId.information: AT: "you are very great and powerful" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: your great name, your mighty hand, and your outstretched arm

contextId.information: The word "land" is used to mean "all the living plants and crops." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
AT: "so I have given you to Shishak as captives" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] )
contextId.quote: so I have also given you over into Shishak's hand

contextId.information: AT: "the king and the other leaders of Israel had humbled themselves," - The king and other leaders are symbolic of all the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
AT: "so that he would always be honored there." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: so that he might put his name there.

contextId.information: AT: "do not let others defeat your people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: do not let man defeat you

contextId.information: AT: "Yahweh sees what is happening all over the earth." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
contextId.quote: the eyes of Yahweh run everywhere

contextId.information: The idea of "himself" stands here for the king's army. AT: "prepared the army to be able to battle Israel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
AT: "I will make myself known to people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
